title: Essential role of MHC II in the antitubercular efficacy of pyrazinamide.
abstract: Antibacterial drug mechanisms have traditionally been examined through a drug-pathogen lens, with limited attention to host influences on drug activity. However, growing evidence suggests that the host environment is crucial for antibacterial efficacy.
